data.prayer: Father, we pray that the state of Oromia be filled with simple churches in every neighborhood.
data.verse: For the earth will be full of the knowledge of the Lord, as the waters cover the sea.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Oromia, Ethiopia
data.section_summary: What people or resources could you pray for in this photo?

data.prayer: Lord, please provide elders whose hearts are completely yours in every town in the state of Oromia.
data.verse: The reason I left you in Crete was that you might put in order what was left unfinished and appoint elders in every town, as I directed you.

data.label_1: One disciple of Jesus for every 5 lost neighbors

data.prayer: Jesus, you are the great high priest, please make the 4,880,138 believers in Oromia, Ethiopia a worthy priesthood under you.
data.verse: Since then we have a great high priest who has passed through the heavens, Jesus, the Son of God, let us hold fast our confession.

data.prayer: Father, please make every disciple be a disciple maker, every home a training center, and every church a church planting movement in the state of Oromia.
Lord we ask you on behalf of the Oromo, Bale people. 0.1% are known to be believers. Oh God, please share with them the great gift of your son Jesus and your kingdom.
Father, help the 4,880,138 believers in Oromia to be spiritually intentional with their relationships among their 22,278,361 lost friends and neighbors.
Spirit, please defend the 4,880,138 believers in Oromia against self-centered spirituality. Open their eyes to the fields ripe for harvest around them.

data.section_summary:
the state of Oromia, Ethiopia has a population of 27,158,500.

We estimate Oromia has 4,880,138 people who might know Jesus, 10,969,155 people who might know about Jesus culturally, and 11,309,206 people who do not know Jesus.

This is 1 believer for every 5 neighbors who need Jesus.

data.prayer: Spirit, cause the 4,880,138 believers in Oromia to obey with immediate, radical, costly obedience, like Abraham.
data.verse: Then God said, “Take your son, your only son, whom you love — Isaac — and go to the region of Moriah. Sacrifice him there as a burnt offering on a mountain I will show you.” Early the next morning Abraham got up and loaded his donkey. He took with him two of his servants and his son Isaac. When he had cut enough wood for the burnt offering, he set out for the place God had told him about.
